arts.ttl: Five European stars who could move to Saudi Arabia in January
arts.sum: Starting at the back, Newcastle shot-stopper Martin Dubravka is a top target for Pro League side Al-Shabab for the January transfer window. €90 million Al-Hilal signing Neymar has been injured for the majority of his 18 months at the club and neither the Riyadh giants nor any other Saudi club managed to win the 2023/24 AFC Champions League (surprisingly claimed by Emirati side Al-Ain) despite a massive financial advantage.

arts.ttl: Cristiano Ronaldo insists Saudi Arabia is better than major European league
arts.sum: The Saudi Pro League has slowly been growing in stature since Cristiano Ronaldo joined Al Nassr in 2022 and the ex-Manchester United forward has doubled down on his claim the division has overtaken Ligue 1

arts.ttl: ‘The club he loves the most’ – Barcelona star’s agent speaks out on Saudi Arabia links
arts.sum: The agent of Barcelona star Frenkie de Jong has this week spoken publicly on the speculation linking his client with a potential move to the Middle East. Chatter surrounding the…

arts.ttl: Saudi Arabia tempting one of Barcelona’s top talents
arts.sum: The Saudi Pro League is one of the few leagues that could potentially sustain De Jong’s current wage demands, despite his market value declining significantly . Barcelona have expressed interest in renewing De Jong’s contract but at a significantly reduced salary compared to his current earnings.
